content: I've been looking for the semantic FHIR profiles that the Clinical Information Modeling Initiative (CIMI) has been developing. But I can't find them online. Have any idea on how I can find them? Also open to suggestions/recommendations for other comprehensive FHIR profiling efforts (if any exist!).
@Patrick Langford @Stan Huff @Nathan Davis ? (Where's Joey Coyle - need to get him on Zulip...)
You can find the draft versions at models.opencimi.org/ig. Mind you, these are draft and in flux.

There is also wgm every Thursday at 2 pm eastern time. We discuss many of the profiles we're working on in that meeting. If you subscribe to the HL7 CIMI listserv you will get meeting invites/updates.

The FHIR profiles that CIMI has been working on can be found here: http://models.opencimi.org/ig/

Note that some of the models/IGs have been reviewed by CIMI and others are waiting for review. Let me know if there are questions. Thanks, Stan

FHIR profiles are here. Look under “Reviewed” tab.

http://models.opencimi.org/ig/ <http://models.opencimi.org/ig/>
